_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT COMMERCIAL WAREHOUSING, INC.



Commercial Warehousing, Inc. (CWI) is committed to being a responsible member of the community in which it operates by giving top priority to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner.  Commercial Warehousing adheres to 29 CFR1910.119 (OSHA PSM regulation) and documents inspections and maintenance procedures per Recognized and Generally Accepted Good Engineering Practice (RAGAGEP).   



CWI's management stresses safety in employee training programs.  These programs include monthly safety meetings with all employees and regularly scheduled internal audits are conducted by CWI personnel.  Periodically, safety audits are performed by third-party auditors. 



A DESCRIPTION OF COMMERCIAL WAREHOUSING, INC. AND THE REGULATED SUBTANCES HANDLED



Commercial Warehousing, Inc. provides 382,700 sq. ft. of temperature controlled storage for perishable goods such as fruits, vegetables, meats and seafood.  These goods are temporarily stored for customers and truck transported to retail outlets.  The refrigerant used to keep goods frozen or refrigerated is anhydrous ammonia.  A maximum of 35,000 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia is onsite at any time distributed between two (North & South) refrigeration systems.  All employees, on day one, receive training on the emergency response plan.  This includes, but not limited to review of alarms, evacuation routes, wind directions (wind socks), and emergency contacts.   Refrigeration employees are members of Refrigerating Engineers & Technicians Association (RETA) and attend several ammonia related trainings every year.  



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Commercial Warehousing has had no releases or accidents in the past five years. 



THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Commercial Warehousing has coordinated its ER plan with the local authority (District VII) and the Polk County fire Department & Hazmat Team.  The local Police and Fi

re departments will assist in notification of nearby citizens in the event of a catastrophic release.  

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Commercial Warehousing plans to continue upgrading aged refrigeration equipment to ensure safe operations.
